params.immutables: The immutable arguments used to compute salt for escrow deployment.

returns._0: The computed address of the escrow.

params.immutables: The immutable arguments used to compute salt for escrow deployment.

returns._0: The computed address of the escrow.

createDstEscrow((bytes32,bytes32,uint256.details: The caller must send the safety deposit in the native token along with the function call and approve the destination token to be transferred to the created escrow.

params.dstImmutables: The immutables of the escrow contract that are used in deployment.
params.srcCancellationTimestamp: The start of the cancellation period for the source chain.

ESCROW_DST_IMPLEMENTATION().notice: Returns the address of implementation on the destination chain.

ESCROW_SRC_IMPLEMENTATION().notice: Returns the address of implementation on the source chain.

addressOfEscrowDst((bytes32,bytes32,uint.notice: Returns the deterministic address of the destination escrow based on the salt.

addressOfEscrowSrc((bytes32,bytes32,uint.notice: Returns the deterministic address of the source escrow based on the salt.

createDstEscrow((bytes32,bytes32,uint256.notice: Creates a new escrow contract for taker on the destination chain.
